* is [omnivorous](/wiki/Omnivore "Omnivore").
* is not a valid [polymorphable](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph") form.
* is a [human](/wiki/Human_\(monster_attribute\) "Human (monster attribute)").
* is normally generated [peaceful](/wiki/Peaceful "Peaceful").
* is [strong](/wiki/Strong "Strong").
* can pick up weapons and food.
* can be seen through [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision"). |                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |                                                                                            |
| **[Reference](/wiki/Source_code "Source code")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 | [monst.c#line3158](/wiki/Monst.c#line3158 "Monst.c")                                       |

The **acolyte**, @, is a [Priest](/wiki/Priest "Priest") [quest guardian](/wiki/Quest_guardian "Quest guardian"). They are capable of [clerical spell-casting](/wiki/Monster_spell#Clerical_Spells "Monster spell") similar to the player [priest](/wiki/Priest "Priest") and other [aligned priests](/wiki/Aligned_priest "Aligned priest").

Acolytes can [grow up](/wiki/Grow_up "Grow up") to become [player monster](/wiki/Player_monster "Player monster") [priests](/wiki/Priest_\(player_monster\) "Priest (player monster)").[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

## Encyclopedia entry

\[...] For the two priests were talking exactly like priests, piously, with learning and leisure, about the most aerial enigmas of theology. The little Essex priest spoke the more simply, with his round face turned to the strengthening stars; the other talked with his head bowed, as if he were not even worthy to look at them. But no more innocently clerical conversation could have been heard in any white Italian cloister or black Spanish cathedral. The first he heard was the tail of one of Father Brown's sentences, which ended: "... what they really meant in the Middle Ages by the heavens being incorruptible." The taller priest nodded his bowed head and said: "Ah, yes, these modern infidels appeal to their reason; but who can look at those millions of worlds and not feel that there may well be wonderful universes above us where reason is utterly unreasonable?"

\[ The Innocence of Father Brown, by G.K. Chesterton ]

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [src/mondata.c in NetHack 3.6.0, line 966](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.0_Release/src/mondata.c#L966)

It may contain text specific to [NetHack 3.6.4](/wiki/NetHack_3.6.4 "NetHack 3.6.4"). Information on this page may be out of date.

html:
Acolyte

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
@ acolyte
Difficulty 8
Attacks Weapon 1d6, Spellcasting (clerical)
@ acolyte
Difficulty 8
Attacks

Weapon 1d6, Spellcasting (clerical)

Base level 5
Base experience 71
Speed 12
Base AC 10
Base MR 20
Alignment 0 (neutral)
Frequency (by normal means) 0 (Not randomly generated)
Genocidable No
Weight 1450
Nutritional value 400
Size Medium
Resistances None
Resistances conveyed None

An acolyte:

  • has a head, a couple of arms, and a torso.
  • is omnivorous.
  • is not a valid polymorphable form.
  • is a human.
  • is normally generated peaceful.
  • is strong.
  • can pick up weapons and food.
  • can be seen through infravision.
Reference monst.c#line3158

The acolyte, @, is a Priest quest guardian. They are capable of clerical spell-casting similar to the player priest and other aligned priests.

Acolytes can grow up to become player monster priests.[1]

Encyclopedia entry

[...] For the two priests were talking exactly like priests, piously, with learning and leisure, about the most aerial enigmas of theology. The little Essex priest spoke the more simply, with his round face turned to the strengthening stars; the other talked with his head bowed, as if he were not even worthy to look at them. But no more innocently clerical conversation could have been heard in any white Italian cloister or black Spanish cathedral. The first he heard was the tail of one of Father Brown's sentences, which ended: "... what they really meant in the Middle Ages by the heavens being incorruptible." The taller priest nodded his bowed head and said: "Ah, yes, these modern infidels appeal to their reason; but who can look at those millions of worlds and not feel that there may well be wonderful universes above us where reason is utterly unreasonable?"

[ The Innocence of Father Brown, by G.K. Chesterton ]

References

  1. ↑ src/mondata.c in NetHack 3.6.0, line 966


This page may need to be updated for the current version of NetHack.

It may contain text specific to NetHack 3.6.4. Information on this page may be out of date.
